Class Alphabet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Alphabet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Decryptor, Encryptor

    public class Alphabet
extends java.lang.Object
    The Alphabet class is used to convert letters to their numeric value (referred to as a letter's "index") and viceversa.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String[] letters
      Static final string containing all letters used in encryption.
      private static int lettersArrayLength
      Static and final integer giving the size of the letters array
      private java.lang.String originalText
      String that holds the text before it is converted to an index
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> originalTextLetterIndex
      ArrayList of Integers used to hold the integer values of every letter from originalText
      private static int spaceHolder
      Static and final arbitrary integer value used as a place holder for spaces when converting letter's to their corresponding numeric index

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Alphabet()
      No argument constructor
      Alphabet(java.lang.String originalText)
      Constructor based on the originalText String which is pulled from a text file in the Encryptor class

    • Field Detail

      • letters

        private static final java.lang.String[] letters
        Static final string containing all letters used in encryption. This is where the index values derive from (0-A, 25-Z)

      • lettersArrayLength

        private static final int lettersArrayLength
        Static and final integer giving the size of the letters array
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • spaceHolder

        private static final int spaceHolder
        Static and final arbitrary integer value used as a place holder for spaces when converting letter's to their corresponding numeric index
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • originalText

        private java.lang.String originalText
        String that holds the text before it is converted to an index

      • originalTextLetterIndex

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> originalTextLetterIndex
        ArrayList of Integers used to hold the integer values of every letter from originalText

    • Constructor Detail

      • Alphabet

        public Alphabet()
        No argument constructor

      • Alphabet

        public Alphabet(java.lang.String originalText)
        Constructor based on the originalText String which is pulled from a text file in the Encryptor class
        Parameters:
        originalText - String containing text to be modified

    • Method Detail

      • getLetters

        public static java.lang.String[] getLetters()
        Returns:
        returns String array of each letter used for encryption

      • getLettersArrayLength

        public static int getLettersArrayLength()
        Returns:
        returns length of the letters array as an integer

      • getSpaceHolder

        public static int getSpaceHolder()
        Returns:
        returns the arbitrary spaceHolder value used to represent white-spaces in letter indexes

      • getOriginalTextLetterIndex

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getOriginalTextLetterIndex()
        Returns:
        returns the ArrayList of Integers containing the original words letter index

      • convertLetterToIndex

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> convertLetterToIndex(java.lang.String textToChange)
        Converts every letter in a string to it's corresponding numeric value (0-A, 25-Z, etc.) and places them in an ArrayList of integers. White-spaces are held with the arbitrary integer spaceHolder.
        Parameters:
        textToChange - String containing the text to convert to an index
        Returns:
        Returns a ArrayList of Integers where each integer represents a letter

      • indexValidityChecker

        public static int indexValidityChecker(int newIndexToCheck)
        Checks to make sure an index number is within the range of (0-25). This method is used after shifting the originalLetterIndex by values from the encryption key. If a number is larger than 25, 25 is subtracted from it to simulate the numbers wrapping from 25 to 0.
        Parameters:
        newIndexToCheck - individual numeric value to check
        Returns:
        returns either the original numeric value or its corrected counterpart.

      • subtractionIndexValidityChecker

        public static int subtractionIndexValidityChecker(int numToCheck)
        Functions identically to indexValidtyChecker except it is used when decrypting instead of encrypitng. If an index value is below 0 it will add that value to 25 to simulate the values wrapping from 0 to 25.
        Parameters:
        numToCheck - numeric value to check for validity
        Returns:
        returns either the original numeric value or its corrected counterpart.

      • convertIndexToText

        public java.lang.String convertIndexToText(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexToConvert)
        Converts integer values to their alphabetical counterpart. Used for both encryption and decryption
        Parameters:
        indexToConvert - ArrayList of integers to convert to text
        Returns:
        returns the string of converted integers.
